content.description: Sit start low and left on the huge rail/ledge, finish up and right and top out on the easy slab.
content.location: located on the boulder sitting on the ravine, facing west. This boulder has a geology description on the trailside.

content.description: The first move up to the small crimp is slightly challenging. From there, figure out a way to get your right hand on the lip/mantel, then move back left and top out.
content.protection: pad on the boulder behind you
content.location: Located on the west face on the block adjacent to the tallest boulder up hill. Sit down start in the middle of the face on the side pull rail. Watch out for the rock directly behind you.

content.description: The first move out left from the two finger pocket was the crux for me. Felt around a v3 move for me, but could vary depending on height. Finish straight upÂ the overhang. Good rock quality and deep pockets up high.
content.location: On the ravine boulder, opposite side of Louie. Start on huge right side-pull loaf and two finger pocket for the left.
